metadata.title: CVE-2021-47548 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ethernet: hisilicon: hns: hns_dsaf_misc: fix a possible array overflow inhns_dsaf_ge_srst_by_port() The if statement: if (port >= DSAF_GE_NUM)return; limits the value of port less than DSAF_GE_NUM (i.e., 8). However,if the value of port is 6 or 7, an array overflow could occur: port_rst_off= dsaf_dev->mac_cb[port]->port_rst_off; because the length ofdsaf_dev->mac_cb is DSAF_MAX_PORT_NUM (i.e., 6). To fix this possible arrayoverflow, we first check port and if it is greater than or equal toDSAF_MAX_PORT_NUM, the function returns.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1078.87').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2061.63').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2043.47').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2026.28').
